title.narrative: 1.2 RIGHT BASED SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: 1.2 Social protection system reforms include a rights-based, progressively universal, sustainable and shock-resilient and child- centered pillar and the tools to implement it, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

sector.narrative: Expanding and improving cash transfers for children

Strengthening the social welfare workforce and direct outreach to families

related-activity.ref: 4320/A0/05/881 1. SUSTAINABLE & INCLUSIVE SOCIAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT FOR CHILDREN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.2 Social protection system reforms include a rights-based, progressively universal, sustainable and shock-resilient and child-centered pillar and the tools to implement it

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic and political transition represented key challenges advancing the social protection floor reforms in 2021;- including its child related pillar. However, the child grant launched in 2020 for children 0-5 from families registered in Tunisian social protection schemes reached;almost 129,000 children (>12% of this age category) in 2021, up from 50,000 in 2020. Moreover, the coverage of 0-5 children was included as one of the indicators in the WB support programme for 2022-2023, ensuring continued investments in early childhood development in the COVID context, and progressive transition to the national budget. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
